page.title: 12The Silver Dee
page.content:
The Spey is swift,the Don is slow,The Deveron strikes a happy mean; But north or south,where'er I go, There's none can match my river queen, The silver Dee.
From linn to sea she glides along o'er granite bed and pebbles grey, Singing a sweet and endless song, And changing oft from grave to gay, The silver Dee.
Among the giant,frowning hills That link our noble Grampian chain,She takes her birth and gathers rills From crystal springs and filtered rain, The silver Dee. From the Scottish Field March 1906
